Updated November     pm



Although Purdue terminated its contract with music downloading service CDigix last spring students are having no trouble accessing music PERIOD

Purdue ended its partnership with CDigix which offered free student downloads on May  PERIOD Downloads could only be played on a computer PERIOD

Katie Burger a sophomore in the College of Agriculture said she can still use CDigix PERIOD

 Burger said PERIOD Usually the radio is how I get music PERIOD I listen to it at home when I milk the cows.I think so many people do it that people dont think its a problemvery seriously PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

The standard settlement fee is about  he said PERIOD He is not aware of any Purdue students who have been sued PERIOD

Tally said the University ended its contract with CDigix because numbers were not meeting expectations and because the music downloading market has changed PERIOD

 than when Purdue and CDigix first partnered Tally said PERIOD 

He said there are no plans for any other service to take the place of CDigix PERIOD
